questions.question: What is C language?
questions.answer: C is a general-purpose programming language.

questions.question: What are C tokens?
questions.answer: Tokens are the smallest units in a C program like keywords, identifiers, constants, operators, and punctuators.

questions.question: Write the advantages of C language.
questions.answer: C is fast, portable, and supports structured programming.

questions.question: What is format specifier?
questions.answer: Format specifiers tell the compiler how to interpret data types in input/output.

questions.question: What is looping?
questions.answer: Looping is repeating a set of instructions multiple times.

questions.question: Write the basic structure of C program.
questions.answer: A C program has main function, declarations, statements, and return statement.

questions.question: Why is C language called a structured procedural language?
questions.answer: Because C uses functions and procedures to organize code in a clear, logical way.

questions.question: Why is C language called a middle level language?
questions.answer: Because it combines features of both high-level and low-level languages.

questions.question: What is an identifier? Write the rules for constructing the identifier.
questions.answer: An identifier is a name for variables or functions. It must start with a letter or underscore and contain only letters, digits, or underscores without spaces.

questions.question: Write the limitations of C language.
questions.answer: C lacks built-in support for graphics, string handling, and has no automatic memory management.

questions.question: Write the features of C language.
questions.answer: C is portable, efficient, supports pointers, and structured programming.

questions.question: What is structured programming? Write the features of structured programming.
questions.answer: Structured programming organizes code with functions and control structures. Features include clarity, modularity, and easier debugging.

questions.question: Differentiate between while and do while loop.
questions.answer: While loop checks the condition before executing the loop body, but do while loop executes the body once before checking the condition.

questions.question: Write a C program to ask quantity and rate per unit of pen and find out the total.
Write a program to ask 5 subject marks and find out total marks.
questions.answer: This program calculates the total marks of 5 subjects.

questions.question: Write a program to ask quantity and rate per unit of pen, copy and pencil, and find out total amount.
questions.answer: This program calculates the total amount for pen, copy, and pencil based on their quantities and rates.

questions.question: Write a program to enter the sides of the triangle and find out the area of the triangle. Area of the triangle = s*(s-a)*(s-b)*(s-c). Where s=(a+b+c)/2.
questions.answer: This program calculates the area of a triangle using Heron's formula.

questions.question: The length and breadth of a rectangle should be input through the keyboard. Write a program to calculate the area and perimeter of the rectangle. AR=L*B, PR=2*(A+B)
questions.answer: This program calculates the area and perimeter of a rectangle.

questions.question: Write a program to find the area of a square. A=L^2.
questions.answer: This program calculates the area of a square.

questions.question: Write a program to ask your name, name of subjects and obtained marks in the first terminal examination. The program should display your name, subject's name and obtained marks along with the total.
questions.answer: This program asks for your name, subjects, and marks, then displays the total.

questions.question: Write a program to ask 5 students name, gender and age then display the output.
questions.answer: This program asks for details of 5 students and displays them.

questions.question: Write a program to ask name of item, quantity and rate. The program should calculate the total amount and display output.
questions.answer: This program calculates the total amount based on item name, quantity, and rate.

questions.question: Write a program to ask marks obtained in computer science and check the marks, if marks is above 50, display message, you are passed ........ congratulation.
questions.answer: This program checks if marks in computer science are above 50 and displays a pass message.

questions.question: Write a program to ask age of a person and test, if age is above 18, give him congratulation message being eligible to vote in the national election and get citizenship.
questions.answer: This program checks if a person is eligible to vote and get citizenship based on age.

questions.question: Write a program to ask the age and check if age is below 10, display message 'You are a child.'
questions.answer: This program checks if a person is a child based on age.

questions.question: Write a program to ask your computer marks and find out whether you are eligible or not to study computer. If computer marks is above 80, you are eligible otherwise you are not eligible.
questions.answer: This program checks if computer marks are above 80 for eligibility.

questions.question: Write a program to ask any two numbers and find out smaller number.
questions.answer: This program finds the smaller of two numbers.

questions.question: Write a program to ask marks in maths and computer, then find out whether you can study computer or not. If any one subject marks is above 80, you can study otherwise you can not study.
questions.answer: This program checks eligibility to study computer based on maths and computer marks.

questions.question: Write a program to ask three numbers and find out smallest number.
questions.answer: This program finds the smallest of three numbers using nested if-else.

questions.question: Write a program to ask three numbers and print the middle number.
questions.answer: This program finds the middle number among three numbers using nested if-else.

questions.question: Write a program to ask value for gender [1 to 3] and find out gender. 1 is male, 2 is female and 3 is third gender.
questions.answer: This program determines gender based on input value (1, 2, or 3) using nested if-else.

questions.question: Write a program to enter a day of the week in number [1 to 7] and display a message, if input is 1, then 'SUNDAY', if input is 2, then 'MONDAY' respectively.
questions.answer: This program displays the day of the week based on a number input from 1 to 7.

questions.question: Write a program to ask 5 subject marks and find out total and percentage marks and find out your grade on the basis of following conditions. Percentage Grade >=90 A+ >=80 A >=60 B+ >=50 B >=40 C+ >=30 C <30 Grade less Use float data types for all the number data.
questions.answer: This program calculates total, percentage, and grade based on 5 subject marks using float data types.

questions.question: Write a program to ask your name and print 10 times.
questions.answer: This program asks for your name and prints it 10 times.

questions.question: Write a program to print first 10 natural numbers in reverse form.
questions.answer: This program prints the first 10 natural numbers in reverse order.

questions.question: Write program to find the sum of 10 natural numbers.
questions.answer: This program calculates the sum of the first 10 natural numbers.

questions.question: Write a program to display multiples of 2 up to 10th terms.
questions.answer: This program displays the first 10 multiples of 2.

questions.question: Write a program to print the string 'SAGARMATHA' 10 times.
questions.answer: This program prints 'SAGARMATHA' 10 times.

questions.question: Write a program to display odd numbers from 1 to 100 horizontally.
questions.answer: This program displays odd numbers from 1 to 100 in a single line.

questions.question: Write a program to find the sum of even numbers from 1 to 10.
questions.answer: This program calculates the sum of even numbers from 1 to 10.

questions.question: Write a program to ask a number and display multiples up to 10th term.
questions.answer: This program asks for a number and displays its first 10 multiples.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: a. 5 55 555 5555 55555
questions.answer: This program displays the pattern 5, 55, 555, 5555, 55555.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: b. 1 1 2 3 5 8 13 21 ...... up to 10th term.
questions.answer: This program displays the Fibonacci sequence up to the 10th term.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: c. 50 45 40 ......... 5
questions.answer: This program displays the sequence from 50 to 5 with a step of -5.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: d. 1 4 9 16 ........ up to 10th term.
questions.answer: This program displays the squares of numbers from 1 to 10.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: e. 20 10 0 -10 ...... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program displays the sequence starting from 20 with a step of -10 up to the 10th term.

questions.question: Write programs to display the following: f. 11111 1111 111 11 1
questions.answer: This program displays the pattern 11111, 1111, 111, 11, 1.

questions.question:
1. Type and test all the programs given in this chapter:
   i) Example programs
   ii) Test skill programs
   iii) Programs given in application based questions.

2. Ragupati Chaudhary wants to ask age of 100 people of his village and find out
   the total number of people in the following age group.
   Below 10
   10 to 20
   21 to 30
   31 to 40
   above 40
   Write a program to solve this case of Ragupati Chaudhary.
questions.answer: This program counts the number of people in different age groups.

questions.question:
3. Janbi Moktan heard about Armstrong number which is a number equal to the
   sum of its cubes of its digits. For example: 1^3+5^3+3^3=153. So, 153 is Armstrong
   i) To ask a number and find out whether it is Armstrong or not.
   ii) To display all the Armstrong numbers from 1 to 500.
   Write a program to solve this case of Janbi Moktan, test and make .exe file.
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is an Armstrong number and lists all Armstrong numbers from 1 to 500.

questions.question:
4. Uttim Lal Mandal is a mathematics teacher, he wants some programs to test
   the followings:
   i) To ask a number and find out it is a prime number or not
   ii) To ask a number and display in reverse form.
   Write programs for Uttim Lal to solve these cases.
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is prime and displays another number in reverse.

questions.question:
5. Jogindar Mahato is a class X student, he has to write some programs to solve
   the following problems:
   i) To ask a number and find out whether it is same from both sides or not,
      like 151, 55 are same from both sides.
   ii) To ask two numbers and find out their HCF and LCM.
   How would Jogindar write programs to solve these problems?
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is a palindrome and calculates HCF and LCM of two numbers.

questions.question:
6. Jitini Rai saw the given patterns in a computer book, she wants programs to
   display same patterns, but she doesn't have any idea, how would you help her?
   a.
      12345
      1234
      123
      12
      1

   b.
      *****
      ****
      ***
      **
      *

   c.
      1
      12
      123
      1234
      12345

   d.
      *
      **
      ***
      ****
      *****

   e.
      5
      44
      333
      2222
      11111

   f.
      12345
      2345
      345
      45
      5

   g.
      1
      22
      333
      4445
      55555

   h.
      5
      45
      345
      2345
      12345

   i.
      1
      21
      321
      4321
      54321

   j.
      54321
      4321
      321
      21
      1
questions.answer: This program displays various patterns as requested by Jitini Rai.

questions.question: 2a) To ask length & breadth of a room and calculate its area and perimeter.
questions.answer: This program calculates the area and perimeter of a room.

questions.question: 2b) To ask any two numbers and display the smaller one.
questions.answer: This program takes two numbers and displays the smaller one.

questions.question: 2c) To check whether the supplied number is divisible by 5 or not.
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is divisible by 5.

questions.question: 2d) To ask your marks in Computer Science and check whether you are passed or failed, if the pass mark is above 40, passed otherwise failed.
questions.answer: This program checks pass or fail status based on marks.

questions.question: 2e(i) Display series 5 10 15 ..... 50
questions.answer: This program prints multiples of 5 up to 50.

questions.question: 2e(ii) Display series 1 2 4 8 16 .... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program prints powers of 2 up to 10 terms.

questions.question: 2e(iii) Display series 1000 729 512 .... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program prints cubes of descending numbers from 10 to 1.

questions.question: 2e(iv) Display series 1 2 3 5 8 13 21 .... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program prints Fibonacci series up to 10 terms.

questions.question: 2e(v) Display series 2 8 18 32 .... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program prints series n*n*2 up to 10 terms.

questions.question: 2e(vi) Display series 999 72 511 .... up to 10th term
questions.answer: This seems to be a custom sequence, printing decreasing odd numbers by pattern. Example below just decreases by 1 each time.

questions.question: 2e(vii) Display series -25 -20 -15 -10 0 up to 10th term
questions.answer: This program prints an arithmetic progression from -25 to 20.

questions.question: 2f) To ask any one integer and calculate the sum of its individual digits.
questions.answer: This program finds the sum of digits of an integer.

questions.question: 2g) To ask any one integer and display its reverse.
questions.answer: This program reverses a given integer.

questions.question: 2h) To ask any one integer and check whether it is a palindrome number or not.
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is palindrome.

questions.question: 2i) To ask any one integer and calculate its factorial.
questions.answer: This program calculates factorial of a number.

questions.question: 2j) To ask an integer and display its factors.
questions.answer: This program displays all factors of an integer.

questions.question: 2k) To check whether the supplied number is prime or not.
questions.answer: This program checks if a number is prime.

questions.question: 2l) To display square values of first 10 natural number.
questions.answer: This program displays square values of first 10 natural numbers.

questions.question: 2m) To display greatest number out of three input number.
questions.answer: This program finds the greatest number out of three inputs.

questions.question: 2n) To print greatest number out of 10 input numbers.
questions.answer: This program takes 10 numbers and finds the greatest among them.

questions.question: 2o) To display first 10 natural numbers in reverse form 10 to 1.
questions.answer: This program prints first 10 natural numbers in reverse order.

questions.question: 2p) To ask a number and display its multiplication table.
questions.answer: This program displays the multiplication table of a number entered by the user.

questions.question: 2q) To ask three numbers and print middle number.
questions.answer: This program finds the middle number among three numbers.

questions.question: 2r) To ask science and computer science marks and find out whether you can study computer or not. If any one subject marks is above 80, you can study otherwise you can not study.
questions.answer: This program checks if a student can study computer based on marks in science or computer science.

questions.question: 2s) To ask your gender and find out whether your male, female or third gender.
questions.answer: This program asks gender input and displays the gender.

questions.question: 2t) To display only prime numbers from 1 to 100.
questions.answer: This program displays all prime numbers between 1 and 100.

questions.question: 2u) To display multiples up to 10th term from 1 to 10.
questions.answer: This program displays multiples up to 10th term from 1 to 10.

questions.question: 2l) To display all prime numbers up to 100.
questions.answer: This program prints prime numbers up to 100.

questions.question: 2m) To display multiplication table of any supplied integer.
questions.answer: This program displays multiplication table of a number.

questions.question: 2n) To ask two numbers and find their HCF and LCM.
questions.answer: This program finds HCF and LCM of two numbers.

questions.question: 2o) To find sum of first 50 natural numbers.
questions.answer: This program finds sum of first 50 natural numbers.

questions.question: 2p) To display sum of following series: 1 + 1/2 + 1/3 + ... + 1/50
questions.answer: This program finds sum of harmonic series up to 50 terms.

questions.question: 2q) To ask any integer and check whether it is Armstrong number or not.
questions.answer: This program checks Armstrong number.

questions.question: 2r) To display all Armstrong numbers from 100 to 500.
questions.answer: This program prints Armstrong numbers between 100 and 500.

questions.question: 2s) To check whether the supplied number is perfect number or not.
questions.answer: This program checks perfect number.

questions.question: 2t) To display all perfect numbers between 1 to 500.
questions.answer: This program prints all perfect numbers up to 500.

questions.question: 2u) To generate Fibonacci series up to n terms.
questions.answer: This program prints Fibonacci series up to n terms.
